page.title: 09THE SAMBOURN TRUST.HATHERDEN
page.content: The following is inscribed on the front of the school-house at Hatherden "This charity school for 24 poor children of Hatherden and Wildhern was endowed by James Sambourn, merchant, born in Andover, Obijt Oct, ye 20, 1725. DEI DONUN, DEO DATUM". The Latin translated "The gift of God, given to God", doubtless sums up in a few words James Sambourn's Christian attitude toward wealth which God had given him.In 1726 they purchased from John Pollen for Â£30 a tenement with orchard and this was "to be rebuilt or greatly repaired to be made fitting for the purpose" of a school.The first schoolmaster,William Best of Winterbourne Dantzoy was appointed in 1727 "To teach and instruct 24 poor children to read, write and cast accounts and learn the Church of England catechism."
